str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From a primary but obsolete verb nupto; a young married woman, including a betrothed girl; by implication, a son's wife.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bridegroom. From numphe; a bride-groom.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Friendly; subst: a friend, an associate. Properly, dear, i.e. A friend; actively, fond, i.e. Friendly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bridegroom. From numphe; a bride-groom.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To hear, listen, comprehend by hearing; pass: is heard, reported. A primary verb; to hear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to be 'cheer'ful, i.e. Calmly happy or well-off; impersonally, especially as salutation, be well.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A bridegroom. From numphe; a bride-groom.
Probably akin to phaino through the idea of disclosure; a tone; by implication, an address, saying or language.
Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.
Joy, gladness, a source of joy. From chairo; cheerfulness, i.e. Calm delight.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Feminine 1st Person Singular
str2: My, mine. From the oblique cases of ego; my.

parse: Verb - Perfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From pleres; to make replete, i.e. to cram, level up, or to furnish, satisfy, execute, finish, verify, etc.
